name: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total
sourceNote: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in public and private lower secondary education institutions (ISCED 2). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Total
sourceNote: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Total is the number of students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year per 100,000 inhabitants. It is calculated by dividing the total number of students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year by the countrys population and multiplying the result by 100,000.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Female
sourceNote: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Female is the number of female students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year per 100,000 inhabitants. It is calculated by dividing the total number of female students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year by the countrys population and multiplying the result by 100,000.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Male
sourceNote: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Male is the number of male students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year per 100,000 inhabitants. It is calculated by dividing the total number of male students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year by the countrys population and multiplying the result by 100,000.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Distribution of students (%).  ISCED Level 5A
sourceNote: Distribution of students (%). Tertiary ISCED Level 5A is the enrolment in tertiary education at ISCED level 5A as a percentage of total enrolment in tertiary education. ISCED level 5A programmes are tertiary programmes that are largely theoretically based and are intended to provide sufficient qualifications for gaining entry into advanced research programmes and professions with high skills requirements.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Distribution of students (%).   ISCED Level 5B
sourceNote: Distribution of students (%). Tertiary ISCED Level 5B is the enrolment in tertiary education at ISCED level 5B as a percentage of total enrolment in tertiary education. The content of tertiary ISCED level 5B programmes is practically oriented/occupationally specific and is mainly designed for participants to acquire the practical skills needed for employment in a particular occupation or trade or class of occupations or trades - the successful completion of which usually provides the participants with a labor-market relevant qualification.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Distribution of students (%).   ISCED Level 6
sourceNote: Distribution of students (%). Tertiary ISCED Level 6 is the enrolment in tertiary education at ISCED level 6 as a percentage of total enrolment in tertiary education. ISCED Level 6 is reserved for tertiary programmes which lead to the award of an advanced research qualification. The programmes are therefore devoted to advanced study and original research and are not based on coursework only. It typically requires the submission of a thesis or dissertation of publishable quality which is the product of original research and represents a significant contribution to knowledge. It prepares graduates for faculty posts in institutions offering ISCED 5A programmes, as well as research posts in government, industry, etc.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Entrance age of pre-primary
sourceNote: Entrance age of pre-primary is the age at which students would enter pre-primary education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Entrance age of 3A upper secondary
sourceNote: Entrance age of 3A upper secondary is the age at which students would enter ISCED 3A upper secondary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Entrance age of 4A post-secondary
sourceNote: Entrance age of 4A post-secondary is the age at which students would enter ISCED 4A post-secondary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Duration of pre-primary
sourceNote: Duration of pre-primary is the number of grades (years) in pre-primary education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Duration of 4A post-secondary
sourceNote: Duration of 4A post-secondary is the number of grades (years) in 4A post-secondary education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Gender parity index for transition rate, primary to secondary, general programmes
sourceNote: Gender parity index for transition rate, primary to secondary, general programmes is the ratio of the female transition rate from primary to secondary (general programmes) to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Total
sourceNote: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Total shows the real transition from primary to secondary regardless of repetition. This indicator better reflects situations in which pupils repeat the last grade of primary but eventually make the transition to secondary. It is defined for a given year as the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary in the following year expressed as a percentage of the students enrolled in the last grade of primary education in the given year who do not repeat that grade the following year.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Female
sourceNote: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Female shows the real transition from primary to secondary regardless of repetition. This indicator better reflects situations in which pupils repeat the last grade of primary but eventually make the transition to secondary. It is defined for a given year as the number of new female entrants to the first grade of secondary in the following year expressed as a percentage of the female students enrolled in the last grade of primary education in the given year who do not repeat that grade the following year.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Gender parity index for effective transition rate. Primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes
sourceNote: Gender parity index for effective transition rate. Primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes is the ratio of the female effective transition rate to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Male
sourceNote: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Male shows the real transition from primary to secondary regardless of repetition. This indicator better reflects situations in which pupils repeat the last grade of primary but eventually make the transition to secondary. It is defined for a given year as the number of new male entrants to the first grade of secondary in the following year expressed as a percentage of the male students enrolled in the last grade of primary education in the given year who do not repeat that grade the following year.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Pre-primary.  Total
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Pre-primary. Total is the number of teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the pre-primary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers at the pre-primary level.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Pre-primary.  Female
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Pre-primary. Female is the number of female teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the pre-primary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of female teachers at the pre-primary level.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Pre-primary
sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Pre-primary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for pre-primary to the male percentage of trained teachers for pre-primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Pre-primary.  Male
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Pre-primary. Male is the number of male teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the pre-primary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of male teachers at the pre-primary level.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Primary
sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Primary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for primary to the male percentage of trained teachers for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Lower secondary.  Total
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Lower secondary. Total is the number of teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the lower secondary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers at the lower secondary level.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Lower secondary.  Female
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Lower secondary. Female is the number of female teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the lower secondary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of female teachers at the lower secondary level.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Lower secondary
sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Lower secondary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for lower secondary to the male percentage of trained teachers for lower secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Lower secondary.  Male
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Lower secondary. Male is the number of male teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the lower secondary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of male teachers at the lower secondary level.

name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Secondary
sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Secondary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for secondary to the male percentage of trained teachers for secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Upper secondary.  Total
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Upper secondary. Total is the number of teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the upper secondary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers at the upper secondary level.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Upper secondary.  Female
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Upper secondary. Female is the number of female teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the upper secondary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of female teachers at the upper secondary level.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Upper secondary
sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Upper secondary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for upper secondary to the male percentage of trained teachers for upper secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Upper secondary.  Male
sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Upper secondary. Male is the number of male teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the upper secondary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of male teachers at the upper secondary level.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Under-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Total
sourceNote: Under-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Total is the percentage of the primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is under the official primary school age.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Under-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Female
sourceNote: Under-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Female is the percentage of the female primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is under the official primary school age.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Under-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Male
sourceNote: Under-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Male is the percentage of the male primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is under the official primary school age.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Pre-primary
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Pre-primary is the share of public current education expenditure that is devoted to pre-primary education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Lower secondary
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Lower secondary is the share of public current education expenditure that is devoted to lower secondary education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Upper secondary
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Upper secondary is the share of public current education expenditure that is devoted to upper secondary education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Post secondary
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Post secondary is the share of public current education expenditure that is devoted to post-secondary education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education not allocated by level
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education not allocated by level is the share of public current education expenditure that is not devoted to a specified level of education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. Pre-primary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. Pre-primary is the expenditure coming from public, private and international sources spent on pre-primary education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Pre-primary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Pre-primary is the expenditure coming from public sources spent on pre-primary education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Pre-primary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Pre-primary is the expenditure coming from private sources spent on pre-primary education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. Primary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. Primary is the expenditure coming from public, private and international sources spent on primary education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Primary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Primary is the expenditure coming from public sources spent on primary education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Primary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Primary is the expenditure coming from private sources spent on primary education expressed as a % of GDP.

sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary is the expenditure coming from private sources spent on secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. Tertiary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. Tertiary is the expenditure coming from public, private and international sources spent on tertiary education expressed as a % of GDP.

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Tertiary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Tertiary is the expenditure coming from private sources spent on tertiary education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. All levels
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. All levels is the expenditure coming from public, private and international sources spent on education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. All levels
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. All levels is the expenditure coming from public sources spent education expressed as a % of GDP. This indicator excludes public transfers and payments to private entities.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. International sources. All levels
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. International sources. All levels is the expenditure coming from international sources spent on education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. All levels
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. All levels is the expenditure coming from private sources spent on education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Current expenditure on education as % of GNI
sourceNote: Current expenditure on education as % of GNI is the total public current education expenditure expressed as a percentage of the Gross National Income (GNI) in a given financial year. GNI is also referred to as Gross National Product (GNP).
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Public current expenditure on education as % of total current government expenditure
sourceNote: Public current expenditure on education as % of total current government expenditure is the share of total government current expenditures for the education sector.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in primary education. All personnel salaries
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in primary education. All personnel salaries is the percentage of public current expenditures on primary education devoted to salaries.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in primary education. Teachers salaries
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in primary education. Teachers salaries is the percentage of public current expenditures on primary education devoted to teachers salaries.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in secondary education. All personnel salaries
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in secondary education. All personnel salaries is the percentage of public current expenditures on secondary education devoted to salaries.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in secondary education. Teacher salaries
sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in secondary education. Teacher salaries is the percentage of public current expenditures on secondary education devoted to teachers salaries.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure in pre-primary as % of total educational expenditure
sourceNote: Educational expenditure in pre-primary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for pre-primary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure in lower secondary as % of total educational expenditure
sourceNote: Educational expenditure in lower secondary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for lower secondary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure in upper secondary as % of total educational expenditure
sourceNote: Educational expenditure in upper secondary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for upper secondary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure in post secondary as % of total educational expenditure
sourceNote: Educational expenditure in post secondary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for post secondary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure not allocated by level as % of total educational expenditure
sourceNote: Educational expenditure not allocated by level as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure that is not allocated by educational level. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure on capital as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4.
sourceNote: Educational expenditure on capital as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. is spending on education capital expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for primary, lower/upper secondary, and post-secondary/non-tertiary education (ISCED 1,2,3, and 4). Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. Capital."
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure on total current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4.
sourceNote: Educational expenditure on total current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. is spending on total current education expenditures expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for primary, lower/upper secondary, and post-secondary/non-tertiary education (ISCED 1,2,3, and 4). Salaries and other current expenditures add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. Total Current Expenditures."
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure on other current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4.
sourceNote: Educational expenditure on other current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. is spending on other current education expenditures (excluding salaries) expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for primary, lower/upper secondary, and post-secondary/non-tertiary education (ISCED 1,2,3, and 4). Salaries and other current expenditures add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. Other Current Expenditures."
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure on salaries as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4.
sourceNote: Educational expenditure on salaries as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. is spending on education salaries expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for primary, lower/upper secondary, and post-secondary/non-tertiary education (ISCED 1,2,3, and 4). Salaries and other current add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. Salaries."
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure on capital as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary.
sourceNote: Educational expenditure on capital as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. is spending on education capital expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for tertiary education (ISCED 5 & 6). Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. Capital."
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure on total current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary.
sourceNote: Educational expenditure for total current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. is total current education spending expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for tertiary education (ISCED 5 & 6). Salaries and other current add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. Total Current Expenditures."
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure on other current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary.
sourceNote: Educational expenditure on other current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. is other current education spending (excluding salaries) expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for tertiary education (ISCED 5 & 6). Salaries and other current add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. Other Current Expenditures."
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Educational expenditure on salaries as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary.
sourceNote: Educational expenditure on salaries as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. is spending on education salaries expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for tertiary education (ISCED 5 & 6). Salaries and other current add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. Salaries."
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary is the expenditure coming from public sources spent on secondary and post-secondary non-tertiary education expressed as a % of GDP.
sourceOrganization: UNESCO Institute for Statistics

name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Tertiary
sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Tertiary is the expenditure coming from public sources spent on tertiary education expressed as a % of GDP.
